website_summaries.verdict: The best all around lifting strap system for whole-body support while moving heavy objects.
pros: Body harness redirects the weight of heavy objects onto the torso, keeping hands and legs free while adding more support
Large straps keep the lifted object from shifting unexpectedly
cons: The shoulder straps can become uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time

customer_reviews.title: The best product that will help make your moving easier
customer_reviews.text: My Wife and I have 4 girls. My oldest daughter is in high school which means we have no help moving stuff in the house. This year we are moving from New York to North Carolina and this product is going to help make a big difference. I highly recommend this to anyone. I hope this review helps
customer_reviews.author: Eman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as designed
customer_reviews.text: This did not work at all. The strap brackets slip out and don’t securely hold heavier items. We were taking a washer upstairs and it started slipping half way up so we thought we set it up wrong. After doing it again exactly according to the instructions and had the same problem. It may work for lighter items but that isn’t what I needed it for. I returned it!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money just get a regular dolly. These seem like they’ll do the job easier but they don’t. The tension rod can’t handle really heavy items, which it says 800lbs. It starts to loosen and things fall. It made it very difficult going up the stairs with a very heavy dresser and the tension rod became loose right in the middle of the stairs causing it to fall right there. A regular dolly would had made the job easier.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Montanez

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: For the money these can't be beat. I've used them to move lots of furniture, including a gun safe. My girlfriend and I carried her washer and dryer down 3 flights of stairs with much less effort than using an appliance dolly. The one size fits all makes them a little uncomfortable, especially for women, but for the average person that only needs them on occasion they're great.
customer_reviews.author: Cap

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! There are moving straps that go on your arms, but the limitation of those is your arms are not able to be used when lifting and the weight of what you are lifting is partly done by the muscles in your arms. I also have the straps that go on my forearms. But, I really prefer wearing this harness on my shoulders and letting my strongest muscles do the work. With these straps, all the weight of what you are lifting is lifted by the major muscle groups of your legs and then your arms are free to help navigate the item. My only regret is that I did not buy these before now!
customer_reviews.author: Jamey

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again, but use a different brand
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these to work however it failed miserably. We were able to move heavy items such as a refrigerator ($2,000+ fridge that is now dented and scratch due to failure of straps) and a super heavy couch but we continuously had to stop and adjust the straps. We thought perhaps it was a user malfunction, but we read directions and watched videos to double check we were using them correctly. Their a great idea and very useful for smaller things but I dont think its worth it to bother with these again.
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Not for easily panicked people!
customer_reviews.text: A person who was already skeptical of the device and is easily panicked is the worst person to help you use the shoulder dolly. Good thing we decided to only use it to move a washing machine 10 ft from a tight space before using the appliance dolly. Having a calm person is essential in using this device! Right now I'm still neutral about this one and hence the 3 stars. I will definitely know for sure with more use and with different people. The shoulder dolly was extremely helpful though in maneuvering in a tight space. I don't think we can do that with an appliance dolly.
customer_reviews.author: fba

customer_reviews.title: They were slippier than I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: My first time using a product like this one, but I wanted to move new appliances out of my garage, so here I am. For the times it was locked in, it was amazingly easy to lift and move a 36" refrigerator, as well as smaller appliances. But for whatever reason, the strap kept slipping in the clasp, sometimes unexpectedly and rapidly, so just be aware if you're also new to this sort of apparatus. My 4* rating is due only to my perception of the unreliability (i.e. ease of slippage) of the clasp. I reviewed extensively the provided documents, to make sure it wasn't something I was doing wrong.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: What a God-send!
customer_reviews.text: I am a reasonably strong 49-year-old woman, but no weightlifter. My medium-build neighbor and I were able to move my old, 240 lb tube TV up a flight of narrow stairs and place it in a truck for the recycling center. Before I found this item, I was at a loss as to how to get rid of this behemoth since the stairs turn and a regular push dolly wouldn't make the corner. Although it was still heavy, I was amazed at how quickly we were able to do our task on the first try. I think I was smart by watching YouTube videos of others using the Shoulder Dolly so I felt more confident.
customer_reviews.author: Math Maven

customer_reviews.title: Great device, moves heavy object with ease!
customer_reviews.text: Works great - huge improvement over the “forearm forklift” that leaves giant marks on your forearms. The shoulder dolly is simple to use, easy to adjust and can handle almost any bulky appliance or furniture. I recently used it to move 2 giant hutches that were 78 inches tall and 44 inches wide. No problem at all. Just make sure you cinch it tight and leave a long enough tail on the nylon strap where it comes out of the metal latch and press the latch roller down.
customer_reviews.author: RolidnotTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tool
customer_reviews.text: I had 3 large pieces of furniture to move to my new house so I got these. They definitely helped with the weight and mobility bc there's no way I could have moved the pieces by myself or even with an extra set of hands. Downside... Using them on the 4 steps out of my old house and 4 steps into my new was a little challenging. Other downside... They can cut into your neck (I didn't have this issue too bad but the person helping me did).
customer_reviews.author: jaimie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Product
customer_reviews.text: Our move ended up happening just after the corona virus took off and we didn't know what to do with having a moving crew in our home. We ended up having the moving company move everything into the garage and let it decontaminate for a week. With this system my wife (5' 4" 110 lbs) and I were able to move all of our furniture into the house without any problems. So wished I had purchased this years ago. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Can't comment on stair use, as we didnt use them for this. But we did use them to move mattresses, box springs, dressers and other difficult to maneuver items during our move. They are easy to use, if you follow directions. And they do help tremendously with proper lifting and lifting posture. Your height makes no difference; like with other moving straps, as these adjust to the individual, and can be adjusted to meet the proper height conditions for the item being moved, rather than just the individuals lifting it. They do not gouge into your shoulder, as the harness distributes the weight over your entire upper body. Great product and highly recommend for moving difficult and awkward items.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Marie Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT NEW CARPET AND HAD TO MOVE OUR HEAVY FURNITURE AROUND. THESE STRAPS WERE VERY EASY TO ADJUST AND NOT ONCE DID THEY COME LOOSE. WE ENDED UP USING THEM THE FOLLOWING DAY TO MOVE A COMPLETE LIQUOR BAR TO THE SECOND FLOOR. THIS BAR WEIGHS OVER 750 LBS AND IT WORKED PERFECT. I READ SOME OF THE REVIEWS AND THINK MAYBE SOME USERS WERE NOT ROUTING THE STRAP CORRECTLY.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Life changing for a move!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I always have trouble moving items together as he is 6’ with monkey arms and I’m 5’3” with T. rex arms. Things are always at weird angles and I usually have to grip with just my fingertips. These straps were a game changer! We were able to quickly load up and move extremely heavy solid wood furniture. We even left the drawers in on a few things Steps were a breeze and these were awesome for putting things in a no ramp trailer. Just squat, tighten the strap more, and stand and the bottom of your furniture is above the trailer floor.
customer_reviews.author: Del

customer_reviews.title: Only good for some things
customer_reviews.text: I realize that these could be useful in some scenarios, but make sure they are going to be useful for yours. If you need to move a couch through a tight corner, the you still have to lift the couch up and twist or turn as needed, and then the belt is not going to be centered again, so no reason to have the belt at that point. Also, most things that you 'could' use the belt for... it's way way faster and easier to just use a hand truck. Again, I'm sure there are scenarios where this belt is useful, but just really think about your scenario before buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma Cocoa

customer_reviews.title: Great to move large, heavy items!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh these things are amazing! My husband and I recently had all of our hardwood floors refinished and needed to move all of our furniture. Our son who lives out of town told us about using these to help a friend move so I ordered them. We are not huge people, my husband weighs about 170 and I weigh about 125 and we had several very tall and heavy one piece antique cupboards to move. Even the discrepancies in our height didn't make a difference, which at first I worried might be problematic. Very simple to use and makes moving a breeze. Great to have your arms and hands free to help maneuver doorways.
customer_reviews.author: Jode

customer_reviews.title: For the most part, worked as it should.
customer_reviews.text: My husband suggested we get a product like this for our move. Mainly for a old, heavy buffet table made of solid wood. It definitely made moving large, heavy objects easier. But, I don't know if I was doing something wrong, but I did feel a lot of pressure on my lower back. I don't know if it was because he's taller than me or the fact we were moving up and downstairs. Also had strap slip a few times, which could cause a huge problem in the wrong circumstance. All in all, pretty good product for the price. You still need to put some effort into moving heavy pieces...I couldn't see moving a dumpster as I saw advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Batte'

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable, sturdy, smart - we loved these!
customer_reviews.text: Used only a couple of times during our move, as we didn't have many heavy items of furniture, but when we needed them, they worked GREAT. Yes, they're awkward. Yes, you'll probably take pictures because they're funny-looking. Yes, they WORK. We used them to move two ridiculously heavy cupboards/cabinets from the 2nd floor of a house out to the moving truck, and then again into the new house. VERY grateful to have saved back pain - and chiropractic/medical visits - thanks to these straps. If you're moving heavy items, invest in these. You'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Erik K.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.  Made moving a heavy chair safer and easier
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in the hope it would make moving heavy items less frustrating and dangerous for us. The first use was to move a large, heavy upholstered chair from downstairs to upstairs. Putting the harnesses on and setting up the carrying strap correctly was easier than expected. Positioned the chair over the strap, adjusted the slack, and were pleasantly surprised at how easy and stable it was to lift and move the chair. While going up the stairs it took some adjustment to the slack for everything to clear the steps (as the chair shifted downward a bit on the strap once inclined) but overall a far superior experience to every moving adventure prior to owning this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Buy these.  Sooner the better.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Where have these been all my life? I first saw some appliance delivery guys using these the effortlessly move a refridgerator up and down stairs with multiple turns. Since then have been able to move heavy loads with my wife and kids up and down stairs. Would have been impossible without these straps. A huge back, effort, and time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy these 35 years ago?
customer_reviews.text: I am former military and have moved about 25 times....never used this. Now I am older and have kids going to college. The wife said: no more picking up and moving. So I convinced her to get these....wow they make a huge difference. All the weight goes to your leg, not your back or arms. You use your body's strongest muscles to pick up what was once heavy and awkward. The only thing you use your hands for is to steady the object. This is great for couches, desks, appliances, etc. The old thing you can't easily use it for are tables, because they don't have a "bottom" to put the straps under.
customer_reviews.author: D. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Really worked!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were very skeptical about this, but it really worked! It was amazing how easy it was to move my heavy bedroom furniture around. Very simple to use and maneuver while carrying the furniture. I’m only giving this four stars because I felt like the part you where on your body slipped a little bit. Would be nice if maybe there was some sort of buckle to keep it in place when you’re doing stuff in between moving pieces. Otherwise it takes a minute every time you reconnect the cross strap to make sure everything is centered on your back properly
customer_reviews.author: Jenny D.

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars!
customer_reviews.text: We got a quote for our 3600sqft house numbering in the thousands of dollars. Bought these on a whim to see if we could move some stuff on our own and decrease costs. My wife and I ended up moving our entire household ourselves!! We moved our couches, beds, solid acacia and teak pieces, etc without any issues. A little tricky going down the stairs due to furniture sliding downwards and creating a feeling of slack for the person on the top step, but we learned to tighten the strap moreso than usual so that the sliding was minimal. Our total, after truck rental + straps, was $250. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Not good for moving a fridge
customer_reviews.text: I am sure these would work well with certain furniture but I would not recommend using them to move a fridge. The straps help you get it off the ground easily but it is extremely hard to walk with the item while also keeping it from falling one way or the other. I have tried to move other items but honestly it is just too risky. It feels like the item could easily fall over if both people aren’t completely in sync.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Helped us move out of our house...
customer_reviews.text: We were moving and saw a similar product advertised on TV and decided to give these a try. We are glad we got these since we were able to move a stand-up piano (400lbs?), Tempurpedic mattress, armoire, and other furniture without worrying about killing our backs. The strips could be a bit more grippy since we did had the strips slip a few times. But we readjusted made sure there was tension on the strips and the metal locking piece to provide the gripping power we needed. Overall satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tangy

customer_reviews.title: Bottom a little too narrow for navigating stairs
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to carry a planter identical to the one shown in their video from our front yard to our back balcony. The bottom was a little narrow for turning corners in our stairwell and the planter nearly slipped out sideways a couple of times. Also, going up stairs everything shifted down toward my 17-year-old son and we had to stop midway up the stairs a couple of times to recinch things. This device is nice for flat surfaces and straight lines, but it is harder to go up stairs and turn corners than shown in the video.
customer_reviews.author: jkaki

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical....
customer_reviews.text: I had to move my entire house in one day. My grown son came to help. I had purchased the straps just to try and of course he laughed at them...until we started using them. We moved huge dressers full of clothes, hutches, mattresses and couches (a bit weird to maneuver) in less than 2 hours. Of course we still had the small boxes but the big stuff was easy with the straps. Highly recommend. Just make sure to have straps snug and don't dip to loosen them and you'll be fine going up or down stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Treyathlete

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I own a furniture company and we are constantly moving furniture into peoples homes. We bought these to help our aging backs and they work great on level or near level ground. However when we use them to take dressers, chests of drawers etc. up a set of interior stairs we seem to have and issue. Usually the guy on the bottom, me, has the piece of furniture right over my head and leaning back. I am the shorter of the 2 delivery people so we will try switching positions to see if this helps. Other than this one issue we are very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lemoi

customer_reviews.title: The straps dont adjust but if youre moving heavy furniture these are a must have!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I have it 4 stars is because the shoulder straps don't adjust, it's just one size so if they are too big then it pulls, if I could make it tighter to fit more snug I think it would have been easier on my shoulders. But these made moving heavy furniture SOOOO much easier. You don't have to find the perfect place to grip things and set it down for a break, you get it all lined up and then lift with your legs. I'll te'll ya, my legs are much stronger than my arms and fingers. The moving went so much faster than planned.
customer_reviews.author: John_or_BethTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: had to move right before Christmas and wasn't sure the lady and I were going to get any help so I purchased these in hopes of less stress on my back which isn't the best. Bit of height difference between tricia and me and we had trouble getting on the same page. we you tubed the product and watched a instructional video from the creator that was very helpful. By the time my friend called and asked if we were ready we had already had everything loaded in the uhaul. I,m talking king size bed with metal hydraulic lifting frame, 6' cedar closet, dressers, washer, and dryer. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: James Doggette

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Help
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I used these to help us move out of our townhouse. They helped tremendously. Just for reference we're both in our early 20s. We were able to move the washer and dryer up from the basement and into a truck. It wasn't the easiest thing we've done, but certainly helpful to have the straps. I don't know if it would have been possible without them. It doesn't make you stronger, or the items lighter. Just prevents you from having to awkwardly carry things and distributes weight (? Maybe, I'm not a physicist). Makes moving things easier. We were a able to more a large solid wood dresser, sofa, and washer and dryer set.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move bulky heavy objects
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 adjustable base bed frames. Each weighed 180lbs. Needed to move them to another location and mover wanted $600+ to do it. So I spent $45 or so on these. They worked great. The weight is split between 2 people and the weight is supported by your legs and shoulders. Was afraid that the bulky boxes would be unstable to move but actually was pretty stable with some slight hand steadying. Overall, I am very pleased with how well these worked. The quality of the harnesses and the main strap are excellent also.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Would have been perfect if it had 2 cross straps instead of one ...
customer_reviews.text: A big help for when you're moving large furniture. Was able to lift a full size refrigerator with ease. All weight transferred to the shoulders appropriately. Would have been perfect if it had 2 cross straps instead of one strap that you have to balance the furniture on. Would recommend to get a different brand if you plan on carrying a large mattress. Would probably be more useful for people who work as movers. We don't move heavy objects too often and hence became useless after our move.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Slipped
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't pleased with it. Tried using them with my daughter and my brother, didnt work properly either time. The belt just slipped through and made it harder to move things. Just ended up using natural man power instead. I might have had them setup wrong, but I don't think so. Wasn't worth the money, good idea though.
customer_reviews.author: ManaPot

customer_reviews.title: It really works.
customer_reviews.text: There were two appliance guys who brought in my 350 lbs refrigerator with something like this. When I saw how effortless it looked to move the refrigerator, I decided to buy one for myself. This thing is awesome and really comes in handy. I had a Samsung Double Wall Oven that was delivered before it was ready to put into an enclosure I was building. With this strap, my wife (5'4) and I were able to easily move the oven and lift it high enough to fit into it's enclosure. Samsung lists the weight of the oven as 270 lbs. It's a real back saver. All you have to do is balance it which is fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Smiling while moving!
customer_reviews.text: I was so afraid of moving heavy things. We have done this in the past hard way. It is so unpleasant unless you have arms of steel to put so much weight on shoulders and arms. I was dreading this move! I have to say picture of guys moving safe sold me on this product! We moved heavy bookcases and were cheery. How could we have moved without this before? Tools make work easy. We moved things up and down stairs and it was fine, didn't even break a sweat. I felt like whimp, but most of the stuff is piece of cake to schlep with this tool. Hurray!!!
customer_reviews.author: iactuallyboughthistuff

customer_reviews.title: A life saver for moving large obejects!
customer_reviews.text: These shoulder dolly moving straps were unbelievably helpful during my move. Between two people, we were able to lift a California king mattress, dresser, and computer desk with ease. The best part, they were incredible inexpensive yet they feel like they are made from high quality materials. I would definitely reccomend purchasing a set of your own, your lower back will thank you! I provided a demo video so you can see these straps in action.
customer_reviews.author: Jonno

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, it worked! Two people can carry very heavy things with easy. Me and a friend carried a super heavy washer down the stairs. He went first and I went behind. It was so heavy that I used both my arms to push against the walls for balance while the straps carried the washer. There’s no way we could’ve carried it with 4 hands alone. These straps worked and I’m so happy I bought it right before our moving day. It helped us carried many other large items as well, couches, dressers, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy N

customer_reviews.title: Damn Handy Product
customer_reviews.text: There is a number of times in life when you have only (2) two people and a large item that needs to be moved. This product makes that possible and while it does require some coordination between the two of you, you can move some very large, very awkward objects in and out of your home without getting injured. I would never suggest this product for anyone who has advanced osteoporosis or other bone and joint issue but otherwise, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: John Rhyne

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought one a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: Literally the most amazing product I've ever purchased. I have no idea how I've moved so many times without buying something like this. Long enough to use for nearly anything (including 7 foot long dressers), wide enough to handle items that aren't well balanced, and sturdy enough to manage hundreds of pounds without feeling concern. I knew it was a good purchase when my new fridge was delivered and moved using an identical pair.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Harris

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad we purchased this item
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased this to assist in our move after buying a house. As we are in our forties, our bodies are not as strong as they once were ;)/ This item was truly Godsend, to say the least! My husband and sons used this in moving our heavy appliances such as Side by Side Fridge, Washer and Dryer. They also used it with moving our heavy bedroom furniture. By using the Shoulder Dolly it leveled out the weight and made moving the item that much easier. I am so glad we purchased this item! This will assist in any future moving of furniture as well. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Angie Shade

customer_reviews.title: Awesome aid to lifting / moving large items.
customer_reviews.text: I had given up being able to move large furniture (even with help) because it's too hard on my back. But with these harnesses, and one helper, we can safely move things that I would not ever have tried without them. Now I can get things done without recruiting as many helpers, and I can help my neighbors when they need it, also. Even though you wear these on your shoulders, they allow you to keep your back straight and lift with your legs, especially since you don't bend down much. Instead of putting your hands underneath something to lift it, you put the strap underneath and your hands stay up top to steady it. Allows much safer lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: Can’t believe how great these worked!!
customer_reviews.text: This item saved us from paying others to move our heavy furniture! I’ve seen these straps used by guys delivering washer/dryer set so we purchased so my husband & I could move our heavy bedroom armoire & 6 drawer dresser when we had new flooring installed. Worked so well we used it on other items in the house that weren’t as heavy but awkward to carry. At one point we had to move the fully stocked fridge - over 250lbs. Thankfully we didn’t have to go far but these straps works awesome! I would highly recommend & am so thankful we purchased this item!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works Amazingly Well
customer_reviews.text: I admit I was HIGHLY skeptical that these would work as advertised. Me and my wife needed to move some heavy appliances and of course the good-for-nothing kids were nowhere to be found, LOL. I have a bad hip and she has a bad back, so I was REALLY worried about trying these out. However, I have to say, they work. And they work REALLY WELL. We moved a stove, a washer and a dryer with these all by ourselves. It was simple and easy. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: El Chupacabra

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what I wanted. I have fibromyalgia, which effects my shoulders quite a bit. It makes it very difficult to grip or carry something for very long. When it came time to move after separating from my husband, I was anxious about not being able to help much. These worked great and allowed me to be an active mover. I would definitely recommend them. And, two days later, my washer/dryer were delivered and the guys were using these same ones. Walked the appliances down the stairs easily. Also - I’m big (5’8” and 260 lbs) and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Curran

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works great!
customer_reviews.text: These shoulder dolly moving straps are awesome! My husband and I, both in our 50s, have less grip strength than we did in our youth. This makes it easy to move larger items like our washer and dryer with no issue. Wish I had bought this years ago. Only negative is that the harness part that you wear is not adjustable. Where the carry strap attaches to it is at my wasted, but my husband's mid-torso due to our different sizes. It's not really a problem as it can be compensated for by where the strap sets under the item being moved.
customer_reviews.author: kfromWisconsin

customer_reviews.title: We could not move the washer.  I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have a washer and I asked my friend to help. We attached the harnesses, did a deep knee bend and I felt strain in my back muscles and my very strong male friend was very agreeable to not trying to go up the 3 steps into the house. I will probably have to hire someone to move the washer. My friend would never have agreed to not proceeding if he felt good about the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Palmetto State

customer_reviews.title: Made moving so much easier
customer_reviews.text: These made moving much easier. That recliner chair sofa? You can move it without issue. The straps can slip a bit when going up stairs so you have to keep pressure on both straps. What we did to help this is to have the person high up on the stairs lower their strap as much as possible, and the person on the bottom of the stairs raise the strap as much as possible so that the object is close to level.
customer_reviews.author: Terassic

customer_reviews.title: Best option for moving heavy objects.
customer_reviews.text: I seriously love these. I used a set at a previous job delivering appliances, and that opened my eyes. Being able to hold the weight with your legs is a huge advantage, and I’ve used these to move things as heavy as pianos (500-600 lbs, I think). That’s pushing it, and it was NOT comfortable, but the strap and harnesses held up fine. It takes some practice to get good at stairs, and cornering must be done carefully, but you’ll get there. Buy these; it’s awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but deducting 1 star for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This was great for moving heavy stuff. We didn’t have stairs but we had 2 steps which made it awkward at first trying to lift our shoulder to keep lifted item straight but eventually got the hang of it using balancing. Very heavy items were lifted without a sweat! Washer, dryer, fridge, and heavy dressers and cabinets were lifted with ease. Price was a bit high for just some stitched fabric but the investment was well worth it! Minus 1 star for the price.
customer_reviews.author: George Dee

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hurt you back! Use this.
customer_reviews.text: Move a lot of heavy stuff? Even if you only move heavy or awkward stuff occasionally this tool is fantastic. Save yours and your moving partner’s back and buy this. Best thing ever purchased for moving. Better and easier that a dolly. Move heavy or awkwardly shaped objects with ease. You can thank me later. Your back will thank you if you get one. product_meta.title: Shoulder Dolly Moving Straps - Lifting Strap for 2 Movers - Move, Lift, Carry, And Secure Furniture, Appliances, Heavy, Bulky Objects Safely, Efficiently, More Easily Like The Pros - Essential Moving Supplies - LD1000
product_meta.description:
Make moving feel effortless with the Shoulder Dolly 2-Person Lifting and Moving System. By using the ergonomic shoulder harnesses, movers and lifters can lift without worry by lifting and securing items better than ever. Not only will appliances, TVs, furniture, and all other heavy, bulky items be more secure when using the Shoulder Dolly, but back pain and strain will be avoided by putting the work on the body's strongest muscles and using proper lifting techniques. 

Whether you are a professional mover, delivery team, or simply moving residences, you can move large objects while keeping your hands free to maneuver doors, manage stairs, and stabilize items even better without putting the lifting strain on your arms. The adjustability of the strap will allow not only unlimited range of motion for the movers but will also allow for moving and lifting nearly any possible item, up to 800 lbs heavy and 10 feet long. This 2-person system was designed by a professional mover to ease the burden of lifting heavy and bulky objects. The kit contains two harnesses and one 12' long x 5" wide lifting strap.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The ShoulderDolly gives you a hand in moving the heavy stuff--and reduces back, arm, and hand strain. This 2-person system was designed by a professional mover to ease the burden of lifting heavy and bulky objects. The kit contains two harnesses and one 12' long x 5" wide lifting strap. To lift an object, both people will slip the harness over their head, place the lifting strap under the object, squat to adjust the webbing for differences in their heights and the weight of the object, then stand up! The ShoulderDolly encourages safe lifting techniques and reduces the risk of injury. Eliminates damage caused by hand trucks and traditional dollies--no more marring walls, floors, doors, or furniture.The ShoulderDolly lifting system makes lifting big/bulky/heavy items easier! By using natural leverage, the ShoulderDolly Lifting System allows two people to maintain proper upright posture while lifting any heavy object. The ShoulderDolly works in conjunction with the muscle groups in your legs and shoulders. The sturdy harness fits comfortably over your shoulders and by using your legs, the ShoulderDolly significantly decreases strain and the risk of injury to your lower back, hands, biceps and forearms. It’s a proven way to move big bulky items, safely, easily and more efficiently than a moving dolly. The recommended carrying capacity is up to 800 lbs, however, that is subject to the lifters ability. Each set weighs 4 lbs. One ShoulderDolly set includes everything you need for two people.

Reduce back pain - Back pain and strain is avoided by ensuring proper lifting techniques and utilizing the body's strongest muscles, the legs and torso. Significantly reduces strain on arms and hands.
Versatility - Due to the seemingly unlimited adjustability of the strap through the buckle, users can move and lift heavy, bulky furniture easier than ever.
One size fits all - Differences in the height of movers are overcome due to the adjustability of the webbing through the buckle.
